title: What type of music do you like, and would you consider that a soundtrack of your life? - Quora

response.answer_text: While I like all kinds of music, including new age (which is old age now!), country, Native American flute music, and Christian rock, the true soundtrack of my life, from growing up late 60’s and through the 70’s into the 80’s, it’d have to be bluesy guitar and soul rock, into soft rock, glam rock, hard rock, some disco/funk/dance, short-lived punk rock, metal rock and uniquely eclectic rock throughout. Beginning with Elvis, Janis Joplin, Hendrix, The Doors, onto Led Zep, Queen, Elton, Air Supply (yes, really) America, Boston, Kansas, Styx, Genesis, The Kinks, MJ, Prince, Aerosmith, Bon Jovi and with some good ol’ Springsteen mixed in, plus a few more of course. But I’d have to say the ONE ENDURING BAND (for me) which stands out and performed every single genre they ever took on to memorable perfection (and the original music I still listen to 50, 40 and 30 years later), IS QUEEN. With their ever-changing unique style, incredible talent (all 4 hit-writing songwriters and masters of their instruments), and the best voice and frontman in rock history, impossible to get tired of the original 4 playing together… EVER. LIAR, from 1974:  WHITE QUEEN, also 1974, though below is a 1975 performance:  SOMEBODY TO LOVE, 1976:  ANOTHER ONE BITES THE DUST, 1980, this below is 1981 & ’82:  INNUENDO, 1991:  THE SHOW MUST GO ON, also 1991 (and for me, so it will; FOREVER. RIP, Freddie):  PLUS all the well-played, well-known hits most of the world already knows! Personally, I like their less-known compositions best. If you think you don’t like Queen’s harder rockin’ hits, then take a listen to some of their other album tracks … might just change your mind. Here’s just one: THE MILLIONAIRE”S WALTZ, 1976, from their Day at the Races album:

The type of music I do like is progressive and psychedelic music. I consider that a soundtrack of my life because it's such fun when you listen to this genre and you can feel go somewhere just by listening to songs. My life is full of color and I like being kind of eccentric because I love trying something new in my new stage of life. Thank you very much for reading.
Dixieland Jazz, Swing, Folk, Old School Country, Classic Rock, Doo Wop, Blues, Disco, Pop, Baroque, Classical, Romantic. I may have missed a couple but all off that is the soundtrack of my life.
